title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions of aliens, pregnancy-related services, and conditions that may complicate pregnancy. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions of aliens, pregnancy-related services, and conditions that may complicate pregnancy, as well as testing or treatment for communicable diseases. Additionally, states have the option to eliminate residency requirements for certain aliens. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions of aliens, pregnancy-related services, and testing or treatment for communicable diseases. States have the option to eliminate residency requirements for certain aliens granted parole or admitted as nonimmigrant aliens. The amendments made by this section eliminate residency requirements for certain aliens receiving medical assistance under the State plan. Effective date is upon enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is amended to provide $25,000,000 for fiscal years 1998 through 2001 and $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. State allotments determination is also amended to include specific guidelines for the Secretary. The funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is amended to provide $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. State allotments determination guidelines are also amended for the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will compute allotments for the 15 States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 through 2007, despite the guidelines for State allotments being amended. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will calculate allotments for the 15 States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 through 2007 based on the ratio of undocumented aliens in each state to the total percentage in all states. The percentage of undocumented aliens in a State for a fiscal year is compared to the total percentage in all States to determine the allotment. Any unspent allotment from one fiscal year can be used in the following year. The unspent allotment from one fiscal year can be used in the following year based on the percentage of undocumented aliens in a State. The use of funds to assist hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens will be determined based on estimates of the resident illegal alien population in each State. The Secretary will pay amounts to each State from the allotments made under subsection (b). Requiring Use of Funds To Assist Hospitals and Providers of Emergency Health Services to Undocumented Aliens. The Secretary shall pay amounts to each State from the allotments made under subsection (b) for hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens. The Secretary shall pay amounts to each State from the allotments made under subsection (b) for hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens located in areas substantially impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. The Secretary will pay amounts to States for hospitals and providers of emergency health services in areas substantially impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens, based on eligible hospital payments under the State plan for emergency medical services. The Secretary will pay amounts to States for hospitals and providers of emergency health services in areas substantially impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. Definitions and special rules apply, with the term 'hospital' defined as in section 1861(e) of the Social Security Act. The Secretary will pay amounts to States for hospitals and providers of emergency health services in areas substantially impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. Definitions and special rules apply, with the term 'hospital' defined as in section 1861(e) of the Social Security Act. Services provided to undocumented aliens by eligible hospitals and related providers are covered under this subsection. The term 'provider' includes physicians, health care professionals, and entities furnishing emergency ambulance services. The term 'provider' includes physicians, health care professionals, and entities furnishing emergency ambulance services. Providers related to hospitals furnish emergency health services to individuals. Amounts paid under this subsection cannot be substituted for Federal payments. The hospital furnishes emergency health services to individuals, and payments under this subsection cannot replace Federal payments made to reimburse states for emergency medical services. The amendments made under title XIX of the Social Security Act apply starting from fiscal year 2003. Permitting states and localities to provide health care to all individuals. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to remove certain paragraphs and redesignate others in subsections (b) and (c). In subsection (c), paragraph (1) is amended by adding a new paragraph (4) excluding health benefits provided by a State or local government or appropriated funds. The new paragraph (4) excludes health benefits provided by a State or local government or appropriated funds. The amendments apply to health care furnished before, on, or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
